intro: Mabea piriri var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered mabea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep purple. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in understory habitats of humid forests.
